quiz.questionText: Why is the word _Science_ in Data Science?

answerOptions.answerText: It uses scientific methods to analyze data
Only people with academic degrees can understand it

quiz.questionText: Learning Data Science is only useful for developers
What do we need to demonstrate that basketball players are taller than average people?
Which areas are closely related to data science?
Which of the following is an example of non-structured data?

answerOptions.answerText: Graph of friends of social network users

quiz.questionText: What is the main goal of data science?

answerOptions.answerText: to be able to make decisions based on data

quiz.questionText: What is a consideration of ethics in Data Science?
Which of the following are a part of ethical challenges?
Data ethics also includes AI and machine learning algorithms
What is the main difference between ethics and applied ethics?

answerOptions.answerText: Applied ethics is a specific type of ethics
Applied ethics is not a real term
Applied ethics is the process of finding and correcting ethical issues

quiz.questionText: What is the difference between ethics regulation vs ethics principles

answerOptions.answerText: Ethics regulation focuses on regular ethics
Ethics principles do not relate to a particular law, while regulations do

quiz.questionText: Which of these are real ethical principles and practices that can be applied?
Which of these could be quantitative data?
Which of these could be qualitative data?
What is the main goal of classifying data?

answerOptions.answerText: To give the data a proper name
To know which method is best to organize it for readability and analysis

quiz.questionText: The teacher is reviewing students’ number of correct answers, what type of data is that?
A company is collecting surveys from their customers to improve their products. What type of data source is this?
A student is collecting data using queries. What data source could that be?
Why statistics and probability are important for data science?

answerOptions.answerText: Because you cannot operate on data without knowing math
Because data science is a science and has strong formal foundation
Because we want to keep uneducated people from doing data science

quiz.questionText: Can you get heads 10 times in a row when throwing a coin?
When you throw a dice, what is the probability of getting an even number?
We want to prove that basketball players are taller than average people. We have collected heights of 20 people from both groups. What do we need to do?

answerOptions.answerText: collect more data, 20 is not enough!

quiz.questionText: How can we demonstrate that income of a person is dependent on the level of education?

answerOptions.answerText: divide into educated and non-educated cohorts and compute means

quiz.questionText: We throw the dice 100 times and compute the average value. What would be the distribution of the result?
A database can be considered a table with columns and rows
Most databases are comprised of
You can avoid duplicating column names by

answerOptions.answerText: creating tables with relationships built in

quiz.questionText: A primary key is

answerOptions.answerText: a value used to identify one specific row in a table
a value used to make values unique
a value used to force capitalization

quiz.questionText: A numeric 'ID' column would be a good primary key
A foreign key is used to

answerOptions.answerText: values that reference the ids in a separate table
values that reference the strings in a separate table
preserve values that change over time

quiz.questionText: Spreadsheets are non-relational data
Identify the difference between non-relational and relational data?

answerOptions.answerText: Relational databases always contain columns and rows
Some types of non-relational data use columns

it is a rich yet simple language

answerOptions.answerText: Try to fill in empty values

What is the first step of the data science lifecycle?

answerOptions.answerText: Acquiring data and the problem to solve

quiz.questionText: Once the next step of the data science lifecycle is reached, you can't go back to previous steps
What considerations should be taken when maintaining data?
What step of the data science lifecycle is most likely to produce a model?
What questions would a data scientist ask in the capture phase of the data science lifecycle?
What are some common techniques in the processing stage?
Analyzing can refer to analyzing models or data
What is important about exploring data before using it in a model or further analysis?
What are some things a data scientist will do when exploring data?
Visualization is never part of exploratory data analysis (EDA)
Which Panda functions provides basic data profiling?
What is the purpose of sampling data?

answerOptions.answerText: Sampling is better than data profiling when looking for errors
Sampling is used to analyze data in a large data set because it's hard to analyze all of it

quiz.questionText: When communicating data to an audience, it is a best practice to focus solely on the numbers and not the story.
Which is an example of Two-Way Communication?

answerOptions.answerText: When a presenter presents to an audience and leaves the floor open for questions & feedback.
When a leader puts out a TV or Radio message to their constituents.
When a brand advertises to potential customers.

quiz.questionText: When an individual is presenting to an audience, and the audience is not providing any feedback, who is acting as the information receiver?
When communicating data, colors can be used to evoke emotion from the audience.
Of the options below, which is the most meaningful explanation of a company's yearly progress?

answerOptions.answerText: We had an excellent year! Our users grew by 30%, our revenue increased by 21%, and we've added 100 new team members.
We had a great year! Our users grew tremendously, our revenue increased by a lot, and we even added several new team members across all divisions.
Our progress year was simply phenomenal. I can't overstate how much of an increase we've had with growing our users, our revenue, or our team.

quiz.questionText: When communicating data to an Executive Audience, which would be an acceptable strategy to take?

answerOptions.answerText: Go in depth with the small details and spend less time on the significance of the data.
Focus primarily on the significance of the data and the recommended next steps based on the data.
Explain the entire context and try to brainstorm potential solutions with the executives.

quizzes.title: Data Science in the Cloud - Introduction - Pre-Quiz

quiz.questionText: What is the cloud?

answerOptions.answerText: A collection of databases for storing big data.
A collection of pay-as-you-go computing services over the internet.
A visible mass of particles suspended in the air.

quiz.questionText: What is cloud computing?

answerOptions.answerText: Delivery of computing services over the internet.
